head.title: A New President at DeVry Institute Campus

hedline.hl1: A New President at DeVry Institute Campus

abstract.p: Diane Engelhardt is named president of DeVry Institute of Technology campus in Long Island City (S)

block.p: DIANE ENGELHARDT, the former president of the Katharine Gibbs School in Melville, N.Y., has become president of the DeVry Institute of Technology campus in Long Island City. Previously, Ms. Engelhardt, 46, founded and led International Technology Development, a company specializing in business and aerospace electronics education. Established in late 1998, the Long Island City campus now has more than 2,000 students studying accounting, business administration, computer technology and other technical fields. ROGER C. ANDERSEN, the former president, left last spring and is now senior vice president and chief operating officer at Heald College in San Francisco.

Established in late 1998, the Long Island City campus now has more than 2,000 students studying accounting, business administration, computer technology and other technical fields. ROGER C.
